Classes#

class model.Model(nx=0, ny=0, nval=0)#

Class containing the models of a simulation

Parameters:
log_taunumpy.array

Array with the log tau

Tnumpy.ndarray

Temperature in K

Penumpy.ndarray

Electron Pressure in dyn/cm\(^2\)

vmicronumpy.ndarray

Microturbulence Velocity in cm/s

Bnumpy.ndarray

Magnetic Field Strength in G

vlosnumpy.ndarray

Line-of-Sight Velocity in km/s

gammanumpy.ndarray

Inclination in deg

phinumpy.ndarray

Azimuth in deg

znumpy.ndarray

z in km

Pgnumpy.ndarray

Gas pressure in dyn/cm\(^2\)

rhonumpy.ndarray

Density in g/cm\(^3\)

vmacronumpy.array

Macroturbulence Velocity in km/s

fillnumpy.array

Filling factor

stray_lightnumpy.array

Stray Light Factor in Percent

Methods

correct_phi()

SIR can give you any value for the azimuth, e.g. -250 deg, and therefore, to compute the standard deviation those values should be corrected so that I have values from 0 to 360 degrees.

cut_to_map(Map)

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

get_attribute(string)

Returns a specific physical parameter.

interp(new_tau)

Interpolate the model to a new log tau scale.

read(fname[, fmt_type])

Reads a binary model file.

read_mod(fname[, fmt_type])

Reads a model file from SIR and assigns the value to the class.

read_results(task, filename, path, nx, ny)

Reads all the errors from the inversion

set_dim(nx, ny, nval)

Sets the dimensions if no data is loaded yet

set_limit(lim)

Cuts the arrays to a specific log tau value (should only be used for plotting).

write(fname[, fmt_type])

Write data into a binary fortran file

write_model(filename, x, y)

Write a model with the given data in a specific format.
correct_phi()#

SIR can give you any value for the azimuth, e.g. -250 deg, and therefore, to compute the standard deviation those values should be corrected so that I have values from 0 to 360 degrees.

Parameters:
None
Returns:
None
cut_to_map(Map)#

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

Parameters:
Maplist

List with the ranges in pixel in x and y direction

Returns:
None
get_attribute(string)#

Returns a specific physical parameter. This can be used if ones only wants a specific parameter depending on a string/input.

Parameters:
stringstr

Determines which physical parameter is returned Options are: tau, T, Pe, vmicro, B, vlos, gamma, phi, z, Pg, rho, nx, ny, npar, fill

Returns:
outfloat

The wished physical parameter

interp(new_tau)#

Interpolate the model to a new log tau scale.

Parameters:
new_taunumpy array

New log tau scale

Returns:
None
read(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float64'>)#

Reads a binary model file.

Parameters:
fnamestr

Filename

fmt_typetype, optional

Type used to laod data. Default: np.float64

Returns:
None
read_mod(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float64'>)#

Reads a model file from SIR and assigns the value to the class. This class will then create the class with nx = ny = 1.

Parameters:
fnamestr

Name of the .mod file

Returns:
None
read_results(task, filename, path, nx, ny)#

Reads all the errors from the inversion

Parameters:
taskdict

Dictionary with all the task folders, x and y positions

filenamestr

Filename of the file in each task folder

pathstr

Path where all the files are

nxint

how many results are read in x

nyint

how many results are read in y

Returns:
None
set_dim(nx, ny, nval)#

Sets the dimensions if no data is loaded yet

Parameters:
nxint

Number of Models in x

nyint

Number of Models in y

nvalint

Number of values per physical parameter

Returns:
None
set_limit(lim)#

Cuts the arrays to a specific log tau value (should only be used for plotting).

Parameters:
limint

log tau value to which the values are cut

Returns:
None
write(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float64'>)#

Write data into a binary fortran file

Parameters:
fnamestr

File name

fmt_typetype

type which is used to save it => numpy.float64 used

Returns:
None
write_model(filename, x, y)#

Write a model with the given data in a specific format.

Parameters:
filenamestr

Name of the saved file

xint

Integer determining which model

yint

Integer determining which model

Returns:
None
class profile_stk.Profile(nx=None, ny=None, nw=0)#

Class containing the models of a simulation

Parameters:
wavenump.array

Wavelength

indxnumpy array

Index or line numbers in mode ‘MC’

stkimxn numpy.array

Stokes Parameter I

stkqmxn numpy.array

Stokes Parameter Q

stkumxn numpy.array

Stokes Parameter U

stkvmxn numpy.array

Stokes Parameter V

nxint

Dimension in x

nyint

Dimension in y

nsint

Number of Stokes Parameter

nwint

Dimension in wavelength

loadbool

Data was loaded

data_cutbool

Data was cut to the inversion range

Methods

cut_to_map(Map)

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

cut_to_wave(range_wave)

Cut the data to the range in wavelengths

read(fname[, fmt_type])

Reads a binary profile file

read_results(task, filename, path, nx, ny)

Reads all the errors from the inversion

set_dim(nx, ny, nw)

Sets the dimensions if no data is loaded yet

veil_correction(nu[, Ic])

Correct the spectrum for the spectral veil by simly inverting the convoluted equation.

write_profile(filename, x, y, Grid)

Writes data to profiles as described in the config file Note to call cut_to_wave, otherwise it writes the wrong profiles!

write_profile_mc(filename, x)

Writes data to SIR profiles as described in the config file

write(fname[, fmt_type])

Write data into a binary fortran file

set_limit

Cuts the data to a specific log_tau value (used for plotting).

Cut the data to a map [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]

Maplist

List with the ranges in pixel in x and y direction

cut_to_wave(range_wave)#

Cut the data to the range in wavelengths

Parameters:
range_wavemultidimensional list

List with the ranges from the config file

None

Path where all the files are

how many results are read in x

how many results are read in y

None
read_results_MC(path, tasks, filename)#

Reads all the profiles for the simulation where indx is the line number

Parameters:
configdict

Config information

tasksdict

Dictionary with the folder names

Typestring, optional

Indicating if synthesis or inversion. Default: ‘syn’

Returns:
None

Parameters:

nyint

Number of Models in y

nwint

Number of wavelength points

Returns:
None
veil_correction(nu, Ic=1.0)#

Correct the spectrum for the spectral veil by simly inverting the convoluted equation.

Parameters:
nufloat

Optimized fraction of spectral veil

Icfloat, optional

Continuum intensity of the FTS. Default is “1.0”.

Returns:
None
write(fname, fmt_type=<class 'numpy.float32'>)#

Write data into a binary fortran file

Parameters:
fnamestr

File name

fmt_typetype, optional

type which is used to save it => numpy.float32 used. Default: np.float32

Returns:
None
write_profile(filename, x, y, Grid)#

Writes data to profiles as described in the config file Note to call cut_to_wave, otherwise it writes the wrong profiles!

Parameters:
filenamestr

String containing the output path of the profile

xint

Position in x

yint

Position in y

Gridstr

Grid file

Returns:
None
write_profile_mc(filename, x)#

Writes data to SIR profiles as described in the config file

Parameters:
filenamestr

String containing the output path of the profile

xint

Position in x

yint

Position in y

Gridstr

Grid file

Returns:
None
